ground_truth: As he reaches the door and turns to look back at her, Alyssa pounces on him, grabs his face, and locks lips with him, big time. He drops his keys and embraces her. There they stand, by the side of the road, drenched, kissing. Banky carries a bag in one arm and pulls out his keys with the other. He picks up the mail on the floor and jams them into the lock, opening the door. He closes the door behind him and shuffles to the kitchenette, passing by the blanket-covered, slumbering forms of Holden and Alyssa, who are out cold in each other's arms. The place looks a mess - like a couple of people were engaged in some tremendous activity. Then he freezes. He looks down again, and drops his jaw and his carton of choco, which hits the floor with a pop. They look at one another, then at the flabbergasted Banky. Holden and Alyssa shoot straight up, eyes struggling to focus. Banky blinks, then shuffles toward the door again and lets himself out. Banky sits on a curb, staring into the distance; Holden saunters up and sits beside him. He follows Banky's gaze, and Banky shoots him a glare before walking away. Holden shakes his head. At an all-girl gathering, Tory, Nica, Dalia, and Jane help Alyssa finish an issue of 'Idiosyncratic Routine'. Tory letters a page, while Nica and Dalia lay-out the artwork, and Dalia drinks wine. Alyssa buries her face, giggling, and they all cackle. Alyssa tries to laugh with them, but Dalia stares at her suspiciously. All four girls stare at Alyssa, a bit horrified. Holden and Alyssa lie in each other's arms, moonlight bathing them. She smokes, and Holden looks down at a book, shakes his head at Banky, and flips it open to a page showing Alyssa's senior year photo. Cut to Cohee Lundon in the parking lot of Food City, addressing the camera. Back in the office, Holden stares at Banky, grabs him, and pins him against the wall, then releases him. Banky brushes himself off. Holden and Hooper peruse laser discs when a young black kid approaches Hooper, holding a comic book, and after the kid leaves, Hooper slips back into his real voice. On the ice, players skid into the corner, and the crowd around Alyssa and Holden goes wild. Player One checks Player Two into the boards hard; Alyssa is into the game. Player Two scrambles to his feet, throws down his gloves, pulls Player One's helmet off, and punches him in the face before yanking at Player One's jersey and gut punching him. Holden's face looks really sour. On the ice, Player One staggers a bit, quickly rights his jersey, and lunges at Player Two, landing a barrage of his own punches.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: As he approaches the door, he pauses momentarily and turns around to cast one last glance at her. At that very moment, Alyssa energetically leaps toward him, seizing his face with both hands, and they passionately engage in a profound kiss. In the process, he accidentally lets his keys slip from his fingers and, without hesitation, wraps his arms around her in a warm embrace. There they remain, standing by the roadside, completely soaked from the rain, yet fully immersed in their kiss. Meanwhile, Banky is casually carrying a bag in the crook of one arm while skillfully using his other hand to retrieve his keys. He dutifully picks up the scattered mail from the floor and inserts them into the lock, successfully opening the door. Once inside, he closes the door behind him and shuffles his way toward the kitchenette. As he moves, he passes by the blanket-covered figures of Holden and Alyssa, who are soundly asleep, wrapped in each other's arms. The place appears disorderly, with scattered items suggesting that a substantial amount of activity had taken place. Suddenly, Banky comes to an abrupt halt. He gazes downward, stunned, and his mouth drops open in disbelief, causing the carton of choco he was holding to slip from his grasp and hit the floor with a noticeable pop. The sleeping couple jolts awake, exchanging bewildered glances before shifting their attention to the astounded Banky. Holden and Alyssa quickly sit up straight, their eyes struggling to focus and comprehend the situation. Banky blinks in surprise before turning around and shuffling back toward the door, eventually letting himself out. Once outside, Banky settles onto a curb, his gaze fixed on the distance. Holden casually approaches and takes a seat beside him, following Banky's line of sight. Without uttering a word, Banky shoots him a disapproving glare before getting up and walking away. Holden simply shakes his head, reflecting on the encounter. As for the all-girl gathering, Tory, Nica, Dalia, and Jane are industriously assisting Alyssa in completing an issue of 'Idiosyncratic Routine.' Tory meticulously letters a page while Nica and Dalia meticulously arrange the artwork, and Dalia leisurely sips wine. Alyssa, unable to contain her amusement, buries her face in her hands, giggling, and the group erupts into joyous laughter. Although Alyssa attempts to join in the laughter, Dalia, with a hint of suspicion, eyes her closely. Soon, all four girls stare at Alyssa, a mix of horror and bewilderment etched on their faces. Later, Holden and Alyssa lie cocooned in each other's arms, bathed in the gentle moonlight. She leisurely smokes a cigarette while Holden, his attention on a book, shakes his head disapprovingly at Banky and flips it open to reveal a page displaying Alyssa's high school senior year photo. The scene cuts to Cohee Lundon standing in the parking lot of Food City, addressing the camera directly. Back at the office, Holden stares intensely at Banky, grabbing him with force and pressing him against the wall before eventually releasing him. Banky nonchalantly brushes himself off. Elsewhere, Holden and Hooper are engrossed in looking through laser discs when a young black boy approaches Hooper, holding a comic book. After the boy departs, Hooper reverts to using his natural voice. On the ice, players furiously skid into the corner as the crowd encircling Alyssa and Holden erupts with excitement. Player One aggressively checks Player Two into the boards with great force; Alyssa is fully engrossed in the action. Player Two quickly regains his footing, removes his gloves, tears off Player One's helmet, and delivers a punch to his face before vigorously pulling at Player One's jersey and delivering a forceful punch to his gut. Holden's expression turns incredibly sour. On the ice, Player One stumbles momentarily, quickly adjusts his jersey, and lunges at Player Two, launching a flurry of retaliatory punches.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As he reaches the door, he slowly pivots to turn and glance back at her, allowing his eyes to meet Alyssa's before she energetically pounces forward, wrapping herself around him with enthusiasm. She swiftly grabs his face with both hands, pulling him closer, and passionately locks lips with him, completely immersing them both in the moment. In the heat of their embrace, he lets his keys slip from his grasp, letting them clatter to the ground, and instinctively wraps his arms around her. There they stand, soaked from head to toe, standing by the side of the road, deeply engaged in a long, lingering kiss. Meanwhile, Banky approaches with a bag casually slung over one arm while using his other hand to fish out his keys. With a quick, fluid motion, he bends down, scoops up the scattered mail on the floor, and deftly jams them into the lock, turning the key to gain entry. After stepping inside, he closes the door behind him with a soft click and shuffles toward the small kitchenette. As he makes his way through the living room, he notices the blanket-covered forms of Holden and Alyssa, fast asleep, wrapped in each other's arms. The room around them is in disarray, showing evidence of prior activity and chaos. Suddenly, he comes to a standstill, his body frozen in place as he takes in the scene before him. He glances down, eyes widening in shock, his jaw dropping open in disbelief. In his moment of surprise, the carton of choco slips from his hand, hitting the floor with a distinct pop. This unexpected noise snaps Holden and Alyssa awake, and they immediately sit up, blinking as they try to focus their eyes on the bewildered Banky. Banky, after a moment of staring, blinks slowly and then moves toward the door again, quietly letting himself out. Seated on a curb, Banky gazes into the distance, lost in thought. Holden approaches with a relaxed gait, settling beside him, his eyes following Banky's fixed stare. Banky responds with a sharp glare directed at Holden before standing up and walking away in frustration. Holden simply shakes his head, watching him go. At an all-girl gathering, Tory, Nica, Dalia, and Jane work together with Alyssa on completing an issue of 'Idiosyncratic Routine'. Tory meticulously letters a page, while Nica and Dalia focus on arranging the artwork; amid the hustle, Dalia takes a sip of her wine. Alyssa, unable to contain her amusement, hides her face, giggling, and soon they all burst into laughter. Trying to join in, Alyssa attempts to laugh along with them, but Dalia gives her a suspicious look, leading all four girls to stare at Alyssa with expressions that betray a mix of horror and disbelief. Elsewhere, Holden and Alyssa cuddle in each other's arms, moonlight streaming through, casting a gentle glow over them. While Alyssa takes a drag from her cigarette, Holden looks down at a book, briefly shaking his head in response to something about Banky, and then flips it open to a page displaying Alyssa's senior year photo. The scene shifts to Cohee Lundon standing in the parking lot of Food City, addressing the camera with confidence. Back in the office, Holden locks eyes with Banky, strides over with determination, and forcefully grabs him, pinning him against the wall with a burst of frustration, but then releases him, allowing Banky to brush himself off. Later, as Holden and Hooper browse through a collection of laser discs, a young black kid approaches Hooper, clutching a comic book. After the kid leaves, Hooper, in a moment of privacy, switches back to his real voice. Out on the ice, hockey players race toward the corner, and the crowd surrounding Alyssa and Holden erupts in wild excitement. Player One aggressively checks Player Two into the boards, and Alyssa's enthusiasm for the game is palpable. Player Two quickly scrambles to his feet, angrily throws down his gloves, and with a swift motion, rips off Player One's helmet, delivering a powerful punch to Player One's face before grabbing his jersey and landing a gut punch. Holden watches, his expression turning sour as the confrontation escalates. Meanwhile, on the ice, Player One regains his balance, adjusts his jersey back into place, and retaliates by lunging at Player Two, unleashing a flurry of punches.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: As he reaches the door of their shared apartment and turns to look back at her, Alyssa pounces on him, grabs his face, and locks lips with him with a passion reminiscent of a dramatic movie scene. He drops his keys and embraces her. There they stand, by the side of the road in a quiet suburban neighborhood known for its tree-lined streets, drenched from the recent rain, kissing. Banky, who just returned from a late-night convenience store run, carries a bag in one arm and pulls out his keys with the other. He picks up the mail scattered on the floor, a collection of bills and one postcard from a friend traveling in Europe, and jams them into the lock, opening the door. He closes the door behind him and shuffles to the kitchenette, an area crowded with mismatched dishes and a perpetually humming fridge, passing by the blanket-covered, slumbering forms of Holden and Alyssa, who are out cold in each other's arms. The place looks a mess, reminiscent of a whirlwind party scene from a college frat house, like a couple of people were engaged in some tremendous activity. Then he freezes. He looks down again, and drops his jaw and his carton of choco, which hits the floor with a pop, splattering cheap tile with droplets of rich brown. They look at one another, then at the flabbergasted Banky. Holden and Alyssa shoot straight up, eyes struggling to focus with the weight of the unexpected morning. Banky blinks, then shuffles toward the door again and lets himself out into the crisp morning air. Banky sits on a curb by the local park, staring into the distance; Holden saunters up and sits beside him. He follows Banky's gaze, which is fixed on a nearby playground where children laugh and play, and Banky shoots him a glare before walking away, feeling the weight of unspoken words. Holden shakes his head. At an all-girl gathering, Tory, Nica, Dalia, and Jane help Alyssa finish an issue of 'Idiosyncratic Routine', a local zine gaining a cult following in indie circles. Tory, who has a knack for calligraphy, letters a page, while Nica and Dalia creatively lay-out the artwork, and Dalia sips a glass of red wine from a bottle brought by Jane. Alyssa buries her face, giggling, and they all cackle, the camaraderie echoing tales of long-standing friendships. Alyssa tries to laugh with them, but Dalia stares at her suspiciously, sensing something amiss. All four girls stare at Alyssa, a bit horrified, perhaps reflecting on a secret just revealed. Holden and Alyssa lie in each other's arms, moonlight bathing them through the small window above, casting shadows that dance across their faces. She smokes her favorite brand of menthol cigarettes, and Holden looks down at a book, shakes his head at Banky in absent thought, and flips it open to a page showing Alyssa's senior year photo from a local high school's yearbook. Cut to Cohee Lundon, a popular local news reporter, in the parking lot of Food City, addressing the camera about the recent community events. Back in the office, Holden stares at Banky, a moment fraught with tension, grabs him, and pins him against the wall, then releases him, their friendship tested but unbroken. Banky brushes himself off, maintaining his cool demeanor. Holden and Hooper, who moonlights as a comic book author, peruse laser discs in a retro shop, a nostalgic nod to a time past, when a young black kid, sporting a superhero t-shirt, approaches Hooper, holding a comic book, and after the kid leaves, Hooper slips back into his real voice, dropping the affectation he'd adopted earlier for show. On the ice, at a local hockey game known for its spirited fans, players skid into the corner, and the crowd around Alyssa and Holden goes wild, the clamor of die-hard sports enthusiasts reaching a fever pitch. Player One checks Player Two into the boards hard; Alyssa is into the game, her enthusiasm infectious. Player Two scrambles to his feet, throws down his gloves, pulls Player One's helmet off, and punches him in the face, a confrontation that reflects the high stakes nature of the match, before yanking at Player One's jersey and gut punching him. Holden's face looks really sour, perhaps recalling a past grievance with similar emotional intensity. On the ice, Player One staggers a bit, quickly rights his jersey, and lunges at Player Two, landing a barrage of his own punches, a physical exchange as raw as the emotions felt by the spectators.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: As he reaches the door and glances at her, Alyssa lunges toward him, clutches his shoulder, and whispers secrets to him, big time. He flings his keys and high-fives her. There they stand, by the side of the road, drenched, giggling. Banky balances a bag in one arm and fishes out his keys with the other. He scoops up the mail on the floor and tosses them at the lock, swinging the door open. He swings the door shut behind him and tiptoes to the kitchenette, bypassing the blanket-covered, snoozing forms of Holden and Alyssa, who are blissfully asleep in each other's arms. The place looks a mess - like a couple of people were involved in some tremendous activity. Then he halts. He glances down again and gasps, dropping his jaw and his carton of choco, which bursts on the floor with a pop. They glance at one another, then at the bewildered Banky. Holden and Alyssa leap straight up, eyes struggling to focus. Banky blinks, then tiptoes toward the door once more and slips out. Banky perches on a curb, contemplating the distance; Holden strolls up and perches beside him. He traces Banky's gaze, and Banky casts him a glare before striding away. Holden shrugs. At an all-girl gathering, Tory, Nica, Dalia, and Jane assist Alyssa in brainstorming an issue of 'Idiosyncratic Routine'. Tory sketches a page, while Nica and Dalia color in the artwork, and Dalia sips wine. Alyssa covers her face, chortling, and they all burst into laughter. Alyssa attempts to join in their laughter, but Dalia peers at her skeptically. All four girls gape at Alyssa, slightly shocked. Holden and Alyssa rest in each other's arms, moonlight enveloping them. She inhales on a cigarette, and Holden glances down at a book, rolls his eyes at Banky, and opens it to a page displaying Alyssa's senior year photo. Cut to Cohee Lundon in the parking lot of Food City, speaking to the camera. Back in the office, Holden gazes at Banky, pushes him, and presses him against the wall, then steps back. Banky brushes off his shirt. Holden and Hooper browse laser discs when a young black kid approaches Hooper, holding a comic book, and after the kid leaves, Hooper switches back to his real voice. On the ice, players glide into the corner, and the crowd around Alyssa and Holden cheers wildly. Player One nudges Player Two into the boards gently; Alyssa is engrossed in the game. Player Two scrambles to his feet, tosses his gloves, yanks Player One's helmet off, and pats him on the face before tugging at Player One's jersey and tickling him. Holden's face looks slightly amused. On the ice, Player One sways a bit, quickly adjusts his jersey, and leaps at Player Two, delivering a flurry of playful punches.

On the rink, players glide into the edge, and the crowd around Alyssa and Holden cheers. Player One nudges Player Two into the rails hard; Alyssa is engrossed in the match. Player Two rises to his knees, tosses down his stick, pulls Player One's boots off, and kicks him in the shin before tugging at Player One's scarf and kneeing him. Holden's face appears really dismayed. On the rink, Player One wobbles a bit, quickly fixes his scarf, and lunges at Player Two, delivering a flurry of his own kicks.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: As the bird reaches the gate and flips to glance back at the statue, Mona leaps onto the bird, grabs its wing, and links feathers with it, in a grand way. The bird drops its acorns and hugs the statue. There they hover, beside the path of the field, soaked, embracing. Charlie hauls a suitcase in one paw and extracts his acorns with the other. He scoops up the leaves on the ground and wedges them into the latch, unlocking the gate. He shuts the gate behind him and tiptoes to the shed, passing by the tarp-covered, snoozing figures of Mason and Mona, who are fast asleep in each other's branches. The space appears chaotic - as if a couple of creatures were involved in some colossal pursuit. Then he halts. He squints down once more, and drops his jaw and his box of cocoa, which clunks on the ground with a thud. They glance at each other, then at the astonished Charlie. Mason and Mona spring upright, eyes struggling to adjust. Charlie blinks, then tiptoes toward the gate again and lets himself out. Charlie perches on a bench, gazing into the horizon; Mason strolls up and perches beside him. He traces Charlie's stare, and Charlie shoots him a scowl before sauntering away. Mason sighs. At an all-dog fiesta, Piper, Lila, Reese, and Casey aid Mona in completing a volume of 'Peculiar Habit'. Piper scribes a sheet, while Lila and Reese arrange the illustrations, and Reese sips soda. Mona hides her beak, chuckling, and they all guffaw. Mona attempts to chuckle with them, but Reese peers at her skeptically. All four dogs gaze at Mona, a bit stunned. Mason and Mona rest in each other's branches, moonlight washing over them. She sips, and Mason glances down at a scroll, shakes his head at Charlie, and flips it open to a sheet revealing Mona’s final year sketch. Cut to Rainy Maleek in the garage of Grocery Mart, addressing the tripod. Back in the den, Mason glares at Charlie, seizes him, and pins him against the shelf, then releases him. Charlie dusts himself off. Mason and Hunter examine cassette tapes when a young green parrot approaches Hunter, clutching a magazine, and after the parrot departs, Hunter slips back into his authentic language. On the rink, skaters glide into the nook, and the assembly around Mona and Mason erupts. Skater One shoves Skater Two into the barriers firmly; Mona is engrossed in the contest. Skater Two scrambles to his paws, flings down his headgear, pulls Skater One's visor off, and slaps him on the beak before tugging at Skater One's coat and belly punching him. Mason’s expression appears quite sour. On the rink, Skater One stumbles a bit, quickly aligns his coat, and lunges at Skater Two, launching a series of his own slaps.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Alyssa kisses Holden passionately as he drops his keys, and they embrace on the street, drenched. Banky enters their messy apartment, finding them asleep together, and is shocked. He leaves abruptly, later sitting on a curb. Holden approaches, but Banky glares and walks away. At an all-girl gathering, Alyssa and friends work on a comic issue, with Dalia eyeing Alyssa suspiciously. That night, Alyssa and Holden lie in moonlit embrace; Holden reflects on Alyssa's past. Elsewhere, Cohee Lundon speaks to the camera at Food City. In the office, Holden confronts Banky and then releases him. At a hockey game, Alyssa is engaged while Holden seems displeased as a fight breaks out on the ice.
